articles.title: Nearly 900 arrested at London protest supporting banned group Palestine Action
articles.description: British police arrested nearly 900 people at a protest in London that was organized in support of Palestine Action, a pro-Palestinian group that the government has banned. The demonstration took place on Saturday, with protesters marching through the city. The police stated that the arrests were made for various offenses, including breaches of public order.

articles.title: Japan's Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba resigns
articles.description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba announced his resignation on Saturday, just weeks after his party suffered a significant defeat in the recent election. Ishiba stated that he was stepping down to take responsibility for the election results and to allow for a new leader to guide the country. His resignation comes less than a year after he took office.

articles.title: Pope Leo XIV declares teen computer whiz Carlo Acutis the first millennial saint
articles.description: Pope Leo XIV has declared Carlo Acutis, a teenage computer enthusiast who passed away from leukemia in 2006, as the first millennial saint. Acutis was known for using his computer skills to spread the Catholic faith online. The declaration was made during a ceremony at the Vatican, and he is now recognized as a patron saint of the internet.
